events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred last evening at an intersection, requesting to file a claim for damages.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under 'Auto Accident' based on the description of the vehicle collision provided.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to assist the customer with the next steps following the reported car accident.
The insurance company formally acknowledged receipt of the claim and assured the customer that the process had been initiated.
The agent requested copies of the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and any witness statements to proceed with the investigation.
Customer uploaded all required documents including the police report and multiple photos showing the extent of the vehicle damage.
An internal investigation began to assess liability and verify the details associated with the reported auto accident.
The investigation concluded that the accident was partially the other driver’s fault; customer’s claim was deemed valid.
A settlement offer covering repair costs and a rental vehicle reimbursement was proposed to the customer for approval.
The customer responded with questions about the settlement offer and requested clarification on rental reimbursement details.
After clarifications, the claim was officially approved confirming coverage according to policy terms.
Payment for the vehicle repairs and rental reimbursement was processed and issued to the customer's designated bank account.
The claim case was closed successfully following payment completion and customer confirmation of satisfaction.
